      67             :   size_t SizeOfIncludingThis(mozilla::MallocSizeOf aMallocSizeOf) const;
      68             : 
      69             :   union {
      70             :     // For a given value of mType, we have either:
      71             :     //   a. no value, which means mMemory is always null
      72             :     //      (if none of the conditions for (b), (c), or (d) is true)
      73             :     //   b. a string value, which means mString/mMemory is non-null
      74             :     //      (if nsCSSPseudoClasses::HasStringArg(mType))
      75             :     //   c. an integer pair value, which means mNumbers/mMemory is non-null
      76             :     //      (if nsCSSPseudoClasses::HasNthPairArg(mType))
      77             :     //   d. a selector list, which means mSelectors is non-null
      78             :     //      (if nsCSSPseudoClasses::HasSelectorListArg(mType))
      79             :     void*           mMemory; // mString and mNumbers use moz_xmalloc/free
      80             :     char16_t*       mString;
      81             :     int32_t*        mNumbers;
      82             :     nsCSSSelectorList* mSelectors;
      83             :   } u;
      84             :   CSSPseudoClassType mType;
      85             :   nsPseudoClassList* mNext;
      86             : private:
      87             :   nsPseudoClassList* Clone(bool aDeep) const;
      88             :

     247             : 
     248             : /**
     249             :  * A selector list is the unit of selectors that each style rule has.
     250             :  * For example, "P B, H1 B { ... }" would be a selector list with two
     251             :  * items (where each |nsCSSSelectorList| object's |mSelectors| has
     252             :  * an |mNext| for the P or H1).  We represent them as linked lists.
     253             :  */
     254             : class inDOMUtils;
     255             : 
     256             : struct nsCSSSelectorList {
     257             :   nsCSSSelectorList(void);
     258             :   ~nsCSSSelectorList(void);
     259             : 
     260             :   /**
     261             :    * Create a new selector and push it onto the beginning of |mSelectors|,
     262             :    * setting its |mNext| to the current value of |mSelectors|.  If there is an
     263             :    * earlier selector, set its |mOperator| to |aOperator|; else |aOperator|
     264             :    * must be char16_t(0).
     265             :    * Returns the new selector.
     266             :    * The list owns the new selector.
     267             :    * The caller is responsible for updating |mWeight|.
     268             :    */
     269             :   nsCSSSelector* AddSelector(char16_t aOperator);
     270             : 
     271             :   /**
     272             :    * Point |mSelectors| to its |mNext|, and delete the first node in the old
     273             :    * |mSelectors|.
     274             :    * Should only be used on a list with more than one selector in it.
     275             :    */
     276             :   void RemoveRightmostSelector();
     277             : 
     278             :   /**
     279             :    * Should be used only on the first in the list
     280             :    */
     281             :   void ToString(nsAString& aResult, mozilla::CSSStyleSheet* aSheet);
     282             : 
     283             :   /**
     284             :    * Do a deep clone.  Should be used only on the first in the list.
